Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer from English
with Jennifer. Let's study basic English.

You can practice with my students, Flavia
and Andreia. Often we start our lessons

with a little chitchat. Chitchat is small
talk. It's light conversation, nothing
serious. We talk about simple things like the
weather. Other times, we start our lessons with a

fun short game. Let's play a quick game a
game of favorites. All right?

Like what's your favorite...? Who's your
favorite...? I'll start. I have a question.

blue. I like black cars.

Again. What's your favorite animal? Dogs.

yesterday? I went to school. I did
my homework. I walked with my dog. Mm-hmm. I walked my dog. I cooked dinner. Nice. What did you make?

Yeah. That's a lot because studying is a few hours. Homework takes time.
So, you studied a lot. A doctor's appointment? You can
say "have" and past tense "had": I had a doctor's appointment or I went to see a doctor.

Right. These are all the things that
we did, and they're done. You're done with

your homework. You ate your dinner. You
saw the doctor. It's done, and that's the

difference between "I went to the doctor"
and "I was going to the doctor." Right? I
cooked dinner. I was cooking dinner. When you're finished,

we say cooked, went, had, saw. When it's
this process and it's not finished,

that's when we use the past progressive.
Right? Imagine I had a different day, and
